content.question: A block attached to a horizontal spring undergoes simple harmonic motion along a horizontal surface. When the block is at its maximum displacement, the force exerted on the block by the spring has magnitude <math alttext="F sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>A</mi></msub></math>, and when the block is at its equilibrium position, the force exerted on the block by the spring has magnitude <math alttext="F sub equilibrium" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>eq</mi></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="F sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>A</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="F sub equilibrium" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>eq</mi></msub></math>, and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub A equals F sub equilibrium" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>A</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub></math> because the force is zero when the block is at its equilibrium position and when it is at its maximum displacement.

<math alttext="F sub A equals F sub equilibrium" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>A</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub></math> because the force on the block is constant throughout the blockâ€™s motion.

<math alttext="F sub A is greater than F sub equilibrium" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>A</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub></math> because the speed of the block is a maximum when the displacement is a maximum and zero when the displacement is zero.

<math alttext="F sub A is greater than F sub equilibrium" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>A</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub></math> because the force is zero at the equilibrium position and a maximum at maximum displacement.

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub A is greater than F sub equilibrium" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>A</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub></math> because the force is zero at the equilibrium position and a maximum at maximum displacement.
